Package pack.player

Class PlayersList

java.lang.Object
pack.player.PlayersList
public class PlayersList
extends java.lang.Object
the PlayersList class deals with the various lists of players - one is generated in each round - and the initial and master lists which are generated at the beginning of the tournament. For the initial tournament and master list, it gets the required number of players from a JSON file that must be present in the data folder of the program

    constructor we don't need to tell the constructor how many elements are in the list so we don't need any parameters

  • Method Details

    • getTotalPlayers

      public int getTotalPlayers()
      getter for totalPlayers
      Returns:
      totalPlayers - the total number of players in this list

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      getter for list size
      Returns:
      int - the number of elements in this list

    • getNumberOfByes

      public int getNumberOfByes()
      getter for numberOfByes
      Returns:
      numberOfByes - the number of dummy players in this list

    • getNumberOfPlayers

      public int getNumberOfPlayers()
      getter for numberOfPlayers
      Returns:
      int - the number of real players in this list

    • createPlayerList

      public void createPlayerList​(int numberOfPlayers) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      creates the required number of players from JSON file
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - int - the number of real players to add to the list
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - exception - if the JSON file is not found

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(Player thePlayer)
      adds the given player to the list
      Parameters:
      thePlayer - Player - the player to add to the list

    • SetLoser

      public void SetLoser​(PlayersList masterList, Player theLoser, int theRound)
      finds the given player in the master list and sets their round reached to the given round
      Parameters:
      masterList - PlayersList - master list containing all players
      theLoser - Player - the player we want to set as having lost
      theRound - int - which round did they get knocked out in

    • addByes

      public void addByes​(int numberOfPlayers, int numberOfByes)
      adds the given number of dummy players required to the list
      Parameters:
      numberOfPlayers - int - how many real players are in the list. used to make sure the new players have unique IDs
      numberOfByes - int - how many dummy players are wanted

    • AddGamesWon

      public void AddGamesWon​(PlayersList masterList, Player whichPlayer, int theGamesWon)
      finds the given player in the master list and adds the games won to their total
      Parameters:
      masterList - PlayersList - the full list of players
      whichPlayer - which player (by ID) we are updating
      theGamesWon - how many games to add to the player's cumulative score.

    • writePlayersResults

      public void writePlayersResults​(tt_gui theGui, boolean dummyDisplay, PlayersList thePlayers)
      Writes out a list of players with their round reached, leaves out dummy players if reqd.
      Parameters:
      theGui - tt_gui - Handle for the GUI so we can ask it to print messages to its textbox
      dummyDisplay - boolean - whether we want to show the stats for the dummy players in the tournament
      thePlayers - PlayersList - this is the master list we made at the start so contains all of the players We could run for a round list if we wanted to summarise the round for some reason

    • writePodium

      public void writePodium​(tt_gui theGui, PlayersList thePlayers, int numRounds)
      writePodium - writes out the top 3 in order. If there is a tie for 3rd place both players are written out this is called from the tournament so needs to be public as that is in a different package
      Parameters:
      theGui - tt_gui - handle for the GUI so we can send messages to it to be displayed
      thePlayers - PlayersList - list of all the players in the tournament
      numRounds - int - the number of rounds that were in the tournament
